result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer M Sharp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Any valid prescriptions must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

No violent contact with victim listed in the criminal complaint.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jennifer M Sharp in court with attorney Joseph Smith.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

Attorney Katie Bricco for Joseph Smith in court.   Defendant Jennifer M Sharp did not appear.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney appears by authorization.  Defense has received discovery and requests time to review.  Hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Nicole S. listed in the criminal complaint. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

Defendant Jennifer M Sharp in court with attorney Joseph Smith.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.
